alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 9:33AM CDT until April 02 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Missouri, including the following counties, in south central Missouri, Texas. In southwest Missouri, Douglas and Wright. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 932 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Elk Creek at Highway Z, Beaver Creek at Crewes Ford Road, Beaver Creek at County Road 524 and Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain Grove, Ava, Mansfield, Norwood, Hartville, Dawson, Huggins and Plato. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
